bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, June 9, 1917

div1.p: Rose writes that he does not wish to publish the yellow fever report yet, but Carter may release information that may be helpful in adjusting quarantine regulations.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, June 9, 1917

INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD

June 9, 1917
Dear Dr Carter:
div1.p:
Dr Deeks of the United Fruit Company has just
telephoned me to ask if we expect to publish the report
of the Yellow Fever Commission. He seems to think the
publication of this report would give them relief in con-
nection with certain quarantine measures which are inter-
ferring with them at this time. I am writing to say that
it is not the purpose of the International Health Board
to publish the report of the Yellow Fever Commission at
this time. You may feel free, however, to use with General
Blue any information which you have concerning yellow
fever conditions in any of the regions visited by the Com-
mission in so far as this information may be helpful in
adjusting quarantine regulations.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours Wickliffe Rose. Dr H R Carter
U S Marine Hospital
New Orleans, Louisiana
